item.title: AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D, The Fastest 8-Core 3D V-Cache CPU For Gamers, Spotted Running on A ASUS B850 Motherboard With 9800 MT/s DDR5
item.description:
AMD's upcoming Ryzen 7 9850X3D 3D V-Cache CPU has been spotted running on an ASUS B850 motherboard. AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D 3D V-Cache CPU Is Right Around The Corner, First Sample Spotted Running On ASUS B850 Motherboard In a post by HXL, we have our first look at the AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D CPU running on an ASUS B850M AYW Gaming OC WIFI7 W motherboard. This motherboard is a premium overclocking design, featuring support for up to 10,400 MT/s DDR5 memory and a 15-Phase 80A power delivery solution. This is likely an engineering sample, but it shows that the chip […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/amd-ryzen-7-9850x3d-fastest-8-core-3d-v-cache-cpu-for-gamers-spotted-on-asus-b850-motherboard/

item.title: Exynos 2600 Launch Tipped To Happen Much Sooner, With Rumor Claiming That The World’s First 2nm GAA Chipset Will Have A Performance Advantage
item.description:
Samsung recently teased its first 2nm GAA chipset, the Exynos 2600, pretty much announcing to the world that it is ready to duke it out with other flagship chipsets, and there’s excellent news on the horizon, assuming a new rumor from a tipster is to be believed. The Korean giant’s premium SoC could witness a launch much sooner than expected, and thanks to the improved lithography, the Exynos 2600 could bring a performance perk to the table. The official Exynos 2600 launch could happen by the end of January, giving Samsung sufficient time to prepare its Galaxy S26 and Galaxy S26 […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/exynos-2600-launch-rumor-from-tipster-earlier-than-expected/

item.title: Intel Arc B370 iGPU With 10 Xe3 Cores Is Faster Than RTX 3050 Laptop, 33% Ahead of Arc A380
item.description:
Intel's Arc B370 iGPU has been tested in Furmark, showcasing a good improvement over the entry-level Arc A380 discrete GPU. Intel Arc B370 10 Xe3 iGPU Is 33% Faster Than Arc A380 8 Xe dGPU In FurMark Benchmark Leak The faster Intel Arc B390 iGPU has been making the rounds at various benchmark databases, and while it promises some amazing performance for an integrated chip, today's leak focuses on the Arc B370, which comes with 2 fewer Xe3 cores and slightly lower clock speeds. This iGPU will be featured in certain Panther Lake "Core Ultra Series 3" SKUs. In terms […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/intel-arc-b370-igpu-10-xe3-cores-faster-vs-rtx-3050-33-percent-ahead-of-arc-a380/

item.title: The Apple Manufacturing Academy Just Became A Lot More Accessible
item.description:
The Apple Manufacturing Academy has just made its resources more accessible by launching virtual training programs. Apple Manufacturing Academy now offers virtual courses on "automation, predictive maintenance, quality control optimization, and machine learning with vision" As part of its efforts to win tariff exemptions for its products, Apple pledged to invest $600 billion over the next four years in the US to create: Moreover, Apple is also planning to: Up until now, the Apple Manufacturing Academy's courses, launched in partnership with Michigan State University, were only available on-site in Detroit. This changes today with the launch of virtual courses on: […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/the-apple-manufacturing-academy-just-became-a-lot-more-accessible/

item.title: Team develops chips that act like brains and makes them scalable
item.description: Developing chips that simulate how the brain works has great promise for AI, robotics, and other fields. But making them so that they're scalable while providing repeatable results has proven tricky. Now, a Yale-led team of researchers has put forth a solution. The results are published in Nature Communications.

item.title: Reconfigurable platform slows lights for on-chip photonic engineering
item.description: Integrated circuits are the brains behind modern electronic devices like computers or smart phones. Traditionally, these circuits—also known as chips—rely on electricity to process data. In recent years, scientists have turned their attention to photonic chips, which perform similar tasks using light instead of electricity to improve speed and energy efficiency.

item.title: Geekbench leak sees Intel's upcoming Core Ultra 7 270K comfortably ahead of Core Ultra 265K — alleged result shows Arrow Lake refresh chip 5.6% ahead of the 265K
item.description: The Arrow Lake refresh is expected to fill in the gap till Nova Lake finally launches. The Core Ultra 7 270K Plus has just appeared on Geekbench and it achieved great scores that show a decent improvement over the outgoing 265K Plus it'll replace, despite running on relatively slow memory.

item.title: Can AI read humans' minds? A pedestrian behavior model is shockingly good at it
item.description: In a striking leap toward safer self-driving cars, researchers at Texas A&M University College of Engineering and the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology have unveiled a new artificial intelligence (AI) system called OmniPredict.

item.title: US Backs Moroccan Firm That Seeks to Produce Key Chip Material
item.description: The US is backing a Moroccan company that plans to produce a highly purified form of silicon used to make semiconductors and solar panels, as Washington seeks to line up alternatives to China for materials critical to modern technology.

item.title: Intel Has Secured a Massive $14 Billion Deal With India’s Tata to Build Semiconductor Fabs, Strengthening Its Global Foundry Strategy
item.description:
Intel has secured a significant investment from India's Tata Electronics to build chip facilities in the nation and scale up production of consumer electronics. Intel To Build Chip Fab & OSAT Facilities In India To Provide the Nation With a Resilient Supply Chain Team Blue is continually seeking to strengthen its balance sheet after a few consecutive quarters of dwindling financial performance, and one of the ways the firm has achieved this is by forming partnerships with multiple entities to secure investments. Following the USG, NVIDIA, and SoftBank, Intel is now reported to have formed a collaboration with India's Tata […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/intel-has-secured-a-massive-14-billion-deal-with-india-tata/
